isis.stitle: TSI 96-08-05 - Instructions to Add a Starter Re-engagement Delay Module

subjectgroup.subject: Instructions to Add a Starter Re-engagement Delay Module

geninfo.para: Operator rapid re-engagement of the cranking motor will cause damage to the flywheel ring gear and possibly the cranking motor. Vehicles equipped with non-electronic automatic transmissions are more likely to have ring gear damage due to operators shifting from "D" through "N" to "R" then back to "N" with starter button depressed. When this occurs, the starter is activated when the ring gear is rocking back off a compression stroke and a portion of the ring gear may be chipped.

To prevent damage to the flywheel ring gear created by rapid re-engagement of the cranking motor, there is now available a "Starter Re-engagement Delay Module" ( Figure 1). The module will not affect the initial operation of the cranking system in any way. However, if the operator discontinues cranking and then quickly attempts to re-initiate cranking, the module will not allow re-engagement of the cranking system for two or three seconds (giving the ring gear sufficient time to come to a complete stop), thus preventing ring gear damage from starter re-engagement.

entry.para: Kit contains the following (all parts in kit will not be used):

svcsubproc.title: Vehicles Equipped with KEY START Systems: Refer to Figure 2.

step1.para: Find suitable location to mount the delay module with two mounting screws or strap it to the cab harness with the module wire leads pointing down.
Turn ignition switch to the OFF position. Disconnect battery.

warning.para: Batteries expel explosive gases. Keep sparks, flames, burning cigarettes, or other ignition sources away at all times. Always wear safety glasses and a face shield when working near batteries to prevent personal injury.

step1.para: Remove the circuit going to cavity "F" of the ignition switch connector.
Install sleeves over the terminal removed from cavity "F" and the BLUE cable of the module and connect.
Insert the RED circuit of the module into cavity "F" of the ignition switch connector.

note.para: Existing terminal will have to be cut off and female terminal provided in kit crimped and soldered to circuit.

step1.para: Cut existing terminals off BLACK circuit of module and crimp and solder on female terminal provided in kit. Install sleeve and connect to IGN side of ignition switch.
Connect white circuit to a good ground.
Strap up and secure all loose cables. Position cables so that they are not routed over any sharp surfaces and do not come in contact with any moving parts.
Reconnect battery (refer to WARNING above) and test for delay feature.

svcsubproc.title: Vehicles Equipped with SINGLE POLE (Two Terminal) Push Button Start Switch

step1.para: Find suitable location to mount the delay module with two mounting screws or strap it to the cab harness with the module wire leads pointing down.
Turn ignition switch to the OFF position. Disconnect battery.

warning.para: Batteries expel explosive gases. Keep sparks, flames, burning cigarettes, or other ignition sources away at all times. Always wear safety glasses and a face shield when working near batteries to prevent personal injury.

step1.para: Remove two way connector from switch. With key switch ON, using test lamp voltmeter, determine which circuit goes to the ignition switch.
Slide heat shrink over circuit identified in step 2. Connect BLACK lead to this circuit and cover with heat shrink sleeve.
Cut terminal off short black lead and crimp and solder on Packard terminal provided in kit. Install this circuit into open cavity of two way connector.
Remove other circuit from two way connector. Install sleeves over this terminal and the terminal on the BLUE circuit and connect.
Cut terminal off RED circuit of module and crimp and solder female terminal provided onto RED circuit. Install circuit into open cavity of two way connector.
Connect white circuit to a good ground.
Strap up and secure all loose cables. Position cables so that they are not routed over any sharp surfaces and do not come in contact with any moving parts.
Reconnect battery (Refer to WARNING above) and test for delay feature.

svcsubproc.title: Vehicles Equipped With DOUBLE POLE (Four Terminal) Push Button Start Switch

step1.para: Find suitable location to mount the delay module with two mounting screws or strap it to the cab harness with the module wire leads pointing down.
Turn ignition switch to the OFF position. Disconnect battery.

warning.para: Batteries expel explosive gases. Keep sparks, flames, burning cigarettes, or other ignition sources away at all times. Always wear safety glasses and a face shield when working near batteries to prevent personal injury.

step1.para: Remove circuit from cavity #4 of 4-way connector. Slip heat shrink sleeve over circuit. Connect BLACK circuit of module to removed circuit and cover with heat shrink sleeve.
Install short BLACK lead into open #4 cavity.
Remove circuit from cavity #5 of connector and insert RED circuit of module into open cavity.
Slip heat shrink sleeve over BLUE circuit of module. Connect BLUE circuit to circuit moved from cavity #5 and cover connection with heat shrink sleeve.
Connect white circuit to a good ground.
Strap up and secure all loose cables. Position cables so that they are not routed over any sharp surfaces and do not come in contact with any moving parts.
Reconnect battery (refer to WARNING above) and test for delay feature.
